title: Hanham Woods Walking Route

images.title: Graeme Churchard from Bristol (51.473110 -2.625987), UK, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hanham Woods

images.title: Philip Halling / Ruined stone building beside the River Avon
images.caption: Ruined stone building beside the River Avon. This old ruined stone building stands on a narrow field beside the River Avon in a wooded gorge near Hanham

images.title: Pierre Terre / River Avon east of Brislington
images.caption: River Avon east of Brislington. Looking downstream as the river turns north away from the railway.

images.title: Pierre Terre / River Avon west of Hanham Green
images.caption: River Avon west of Hanham Green

images.title: Damon Knight / Hanham Green
images.caption: Hanham Green. Westerly view from the hill above Mount Pleasant Farm, close to the trig point 4538, across the ring road (obscured by the slope), to Hanham Green (in top third of the photo).

images.title: Cottages, Hanham by Vieve Forward, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cottages, Hanham

description: This walk visits Hanham Woods in the south eastern part of Bristol. You can start the walk from the Avon Valley Woodland car park just to the east of the woods at Hanham Green. From here you head west to Hencliff Wood where there's some nice peaceful woodland trails with lovely views of the river Avon. In the woods you can also pick up the River Avon Trail and enjoy a stroll along the river. Head east from the car park and you could extend the walk by climbing up to the lovely viewpoint at Hanham Green. Just to the north there's the popular Conham River Park. There's another car park here providing an alternative start point for the walk. Along with Bickley Wood and Hencliffe Wood the park forms the Avon Valley Woodlands Nature Reserve.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woods are great for dog walking so you'll probably see other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just over a mile to the east you will find Willsbridge Mill. There's nice trails here along the Siston Brook and an interesting museum where you can learn all about the history of the early 18th century mill. Just to the west you can pick up some pleasant nature trails along the Brislington Brook in the Nightingale Valley Nature Reserve.

display_address: Harefield Close, Hanham Abbots, South Gloucestershire, West of England, England, BS15 3TD, United Kingdom
